contentrichtext.text: {{Other uses}} {{Infobox Venezuelan state |name = Guárico |image_flag = Flag of Guarico State.svg |image_shield = Ve)guarico.png |motto = Si amas la libertad, ven a mis pampas<br>({{lang-es|If you love liberty, come to my plains}}) |image_map = Venezuela Guarico State Location.svg |latd = 8.7 |longd = -66.61 |date_creation = 1899 |capital = [[San Juan de los Morros]] |area = 64986 |area_percentage = 7.1 |area_rank = 4th |area_footnotes =<ref name=Guarico>{{es}} guarico.gob.ve, [http://www.guarico.gob.ve/wordpress/?page_id=24 Acerca de Guarico]</ref> |population = 745100 |population_as_of = 2007 est. |population_percentage = 2.85 |population_rank = 16th |emblematic_tree = Palma llanera |binomial_name = Copernicia tectorum |iso_code = [[ISO 3166-2:VE|VE-J]] |governor = [[Ramón Rodríguez Chacín]]|mandate_start = 2012 |mandate_end = present |demonym = Guariqueño/a |website = http://www.guarico.gob.ve |footnotes = }} [[File:2007 02 Capybaras 05.jpg|thumb|200px|Hato La Fe, [[Calabozo]], [[Los Llanos, Venezuela|Llanos]] of the Guárico state.]] [[File:Parque Nacional Guatopo Guárico.jpg|thumb|right|200px|[[Guatopo National Park]].]] [[File:Río El Castrero 1.JPG|thumb|right|200px|Waterfalls in the El Castrero River.]] '''Guárico''' ({{lang-es|Estado Guárico}}, {{IPA-es|esˈtaðo ˈɣwaɾiko|IPA}}) is one of the 23 [[States of Venezuela|states]] of [[Venezuela]]. The state capital is [[San Juan de Los Morros]]. Guárico State covers a total surface area of 64 986 km² and, in 2007, had an estimated population of 745,100. It is named for the [[Guárico River]]. {{See also|Administrative divisions of Venezuela}} ==History== During [[Colonial Venezuela]], the territory of Guárico State was part of the [[Province of Venezuela]]. Guárico Province was created as a [[Provinces of Venezuela|Province of Venezuela]] in 1848 by decree of President [[José Tadeo Monagas]], and following the [[Federal War]], Guárico State was created as a [[States of Venezuela|State of Venezuela]] in 1864. In the late nineteenth century (from 1881) it was involved in a series of re-arrangements of Venezuelan states, eventually re-emerging as an independent state in 1899. Its first capital was [[Calabozo]] (until October 1874), its second [[Ortiz, Guárico|Ortiz]] (until 1934), when the capital was moved to [[San Juan de los Morros]].<ref>{{es}} guaricoenlinea.com, [http://www.guaricoenlinea.com/guarico/historia.html Historia]</ref> ==Municipalities and municipal seats== # [[Camaguán Municipality|Camaguán]] ([[Camaguán]]) # [[Chaguaramas Municipality|Chaguaramas]] ([[Chaguaramas, Venezuela|Chaguaramas]]) # [[El Socorro Municipality|El Socorro]] ([[El Socorro, Venezuela|El Socorro]]) # [[Francisco de Miranda Municipality, Guárico|Francisco de Miranda]] ([[Calabozo]]) # [[José Félix Ribas Municipality, Guárico|José Félix Ribas]] ([[Tucupido]]) # [[José Tadeo Monagas Municipality|José Tadeo Monagas]] ([[Altagracia de Orituco]]) # [[Juan Germán Roscio Municipality|Juan Germán Roscio]] ([[San Juan de los Morros]]) # [[Julián Mellado Municipality|Julián Mellado]] ([[El Sombrero]]) # [[Las Mercedes Municipality|Las Mercedes]] ([[Las Mercedes del Llano]]) # [[Leonardo Infante Municipality|Leonardo Infante]] ([[Valle de la Pascua]]) # [[Ortiz Municipality|Ortiz]] ([[Ortiz, Guárico|Ortiz]]) # [[Pedro Zaraza Municipality|Pedro Zaraza]] ([[Zaraza, Guárico|Zaraza]]) # [[San Gerónimo de Guayabal Municipality|San Gerónimo de Guayabal]] ([[Guayabal, Venezuela|Guayabal]]) # [[San José de Guaribe Municipality|San José de Guaribe]] ([[San José de Guaribe]]) # [[Santa María de Ipire Municipality|Santa María de Ipire]] ([[Santa María de Ipire]]) ==See also== * [[States of Venezuela]] * [[John the Baptist Monument]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category}} * [http://www.guarico.com.ve guarico.com.ve] {{Administrative divisions of Venezuela}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Guarico}} [[Category:Guárico| ]] [[Category:States of Venezuela]] [[Category:States and territories established in 1900]]
